entry.title: Ukraine Strikes Occupied Kherson as More Russians Flee
entry.content: Ukrainian artillery struck the ferry crossing in the southern city of Kherson, the only regional capital captured by Moscow since the February invasion, as Russian forces pounded the cities of Zaporizhzhia and Kharkiv with renewed strikes.

entry.title: Europe's Energy Shock Spurs Rethink of Liberalized Gas Markets
entry.content: Rocked by its biggest energy shock since the 1970s, Europe is unpicking parts of a two-decade endeavor to foster a competitive market in natural gas.

entry.title: Russia Is Offering Extra Payments to Mobilized Troops
entry.content: Subsidies, intended to bolster families of men called up in the unpopular draft for the war in Ukraine, are rolling out unevenly and sparking criticism.
